result.execSummary:
The defendant Marlon Deangelo Cleveland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property (Less Than $2,500 Damage) [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during probation.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
Court waived all nonmandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigenty.
-Court set restitution at 0.

Absolute sobriety.  No illegal drugs.
No contact with victim S.C. or M.B.

charges.descr: Criminal Damage to Property (Less Than $2,500 Damage)

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: count 1.  Straight time.  No huber release.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marlon Deangelo Cleveland

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marlon Deangelo Cleveland in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNTS 2 and 3: 
  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to defendant's plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he/she and may not possess any firearms.
AS TO COUNTS 1 and 4: per plea negotiations and on the State's motion, Court ordered Counts 1 and 4 dismissed and read in.

  Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the state, defense counsel and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 2: 
Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION.  COURT STAYS sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 18 months.
AS TO COUNT 3: 
Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, consecutive to Count 1, with credit for 7 days time served.  COURT STAYS sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 18 months.
.
.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
-provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-Court waived all non mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent;
-absolute sobriety, no illegal drugs;
-complete 50 hours of community service;
-no contact with victim S.C. or M. B., 
-complete Batterers Inervention Program.

Court set restitution at 0.
If defendant is revoked, defendant is to serve straight time. No huber release.

Appeal rights given. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Copy given to defendant. -- gmb

Defendant Marlon Deangelo Cleveland in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case is adjourned to 6-3-22 at 3:00 pm for plea and sentencing in person in Room 504 of the Courthouse.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Marlon Deangelo Cleveland in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Officer Erick Rummel.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10 on 4-28-22 at 1:30 pm for a status conference.
  This hearing will be streamed live on DAcast:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marlon Deangelo Cleveland in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marlon Deangelo Cleveland appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel is newly appointed and requests preliminary hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Marlon Deangelo Cleveland in court.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Case in court for a preliminary hearing.  No attorney has been appointed yet.  Case is adjourned to 3-1-22 at 8:30 am for status of counsel.
  This hearing will be streamed live on DAcast:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Status conference scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with MB, MH, SG.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Marlon Deangelo Cleveland in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Marlon Deangelo Cleveland in custody.  Mario Fiumefreddo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
As to Count 1:   Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
